snippet: The recession has not stopped luxury shopping and ostentatiousness from thriving, and few experiences in New York exemplified this more than the Luxury Review trade show.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column on experience of attending the Luxury Review, a trade show for purveyors of luxury goods, during a time when the nation is still struggling to emerge from a recession; says belief that some wealthy New Yorkers remain ambivalent about money and reluctant to display their wealth, and are consequently more virtuous than their showier counterparts in other places, is becoming harder to maintain.
lead_paragraph: The recession has not stopped luxury shopping and ostentatiousness from thriving, and few experiences in New York exemplified this more than the Luxury Review trade show.
